intro: Eriotheca bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia eriotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
